item.title: Morgan add a quote by Anthony Hopkins
item.description: "I once asked a Jesuit preist what was the best short prayer he knew. He said "Fuck it." as in "Fuck it, it's in Gods hands." -- Anthony Hopkins

item.title: Morgan add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "Nor does God whisper through the trees. His voice is not to be mistaken. When men hear it they fall to their knees and their souls are riven and they cry out to Him and there is no fear but only wildness of heart that springs from such longing..." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Morgan add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "War was always here. Before man was, war waited for him. The ultimate trade awaiting its ultimate practitioner." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Morgan add a quote by Thomas Pynchon
item.description: "They're in love. Fuck the war." -- Thomas Pynchon

item.title: Morgan add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "The rain falls upon the just And also on the unjust fellas But mostly it falls upon the just Cause the unjust have the just's umbrellas" -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Morgan add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "On the meridian of time, there is no injustice: there is only the poetry of motion creating the illusion of truth and drama." -- Henry Miller

item.title: Morgan add a quote by Barry Hannah
item.description: "Ring!" he shrieked at the vapid instrument." -- Barry Hannah

item.title: Morgan add a quote by Ogden Nash
item.description: "A jolly young fellow from Yuma Told an elephant joke to a puma; now his skeleton lies beneath hot western skies- the puma had no sense of huma" -- Ogden Nash

item.title: Morgan add a quote by Ogden Nash
item.description: "Hark to the sky of a seagull! He cries because he's not an eagle. Oh, what if you were you silly he-gull? What would you say to your she-gull?" -- Ogden Nash

item.title: Morgan add a quote by Annie Dillard
item.description: "Nature is, above all, profligate. Don't believe them when they tell you how economical and thrifty nature is, whose leaves return to the soil. Wouldn't it be cheaper to leave them on the tree in the first place? This deciduous business alone is a radical scheme, the brainchild of a deranged manic-depressive with limitless capital. Extravagance! Nature will try anything once." -- Annie Dillard

item.title: Morgan add a quote by Annie Dillard
item.description: "To dust is only to forestall burial " -- Annie Dillard

item.title: Morgan add a quote by Denise Levertov
item.description: "You have come to the shore. There are no instructions." -- Denise Levertov

item.title: Morgan add a quote by Dorothy Barresi
item.description:
"Your enemies call it comeuppance and relish the details of a drug too fine, how long you must have dangled there beside yourself. In the middle distance of your twenty-ninth year, night split open like a fighter's bruised palm, a purple ripeness.
Friends shook their heads. With you it was always the next attractive trouble, as if an arranged marriage had been made in a country of wing walkers, lion tamers, choirboys leaping from bellpulls into the high numb glitter, and you, born with the breath of wild on your tongue brash as gin.
True, it was charming for a while. Your devil's balance, your debts. Then no one was laughing. Hypodermic needles and cash registers emptied themselves in your presence. Cars went head-on. Sympathy, old motor, ran out or we grew old, our tongues wearing little grooves in our mouths clucking disappointment.
Michael, what pulled you up by upstart roots and set you packing, left the rest of us here, body-heavy on the edge of our pews. Over the reverend's lament we could still hear laughter, your mustache the angled black wings of a perfect crow. Later we taught ourselves the proper method for mourning haphazard life: salt, tequila, lemon. Drinking and drifting in your honor we barely felt a thing." -- Dorothy Barresi
